main event: A UFO sighting was reported by Mr. and Mrs. at their residence in St. Louis, Missouri on May 7, 1949. The object appeared to be about the size of a light private airplane, was dark reddish brown, and displayed an oscillating motion as it traveled at a high speed and disappeared in the atmosphere.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 45 seconds, during which the object covered an angle of approximately 60 degrees.
Mr. and Mrs. provided consistent descriptions of the UFO, with Mr. describing it as triangular with no visible tail, and Mrs. noting a reddish glow on the right edge of the object.
Weather conditions were fair at the time of the sighting, with twilight or approximately 20-30 minutes before official sunset.
The closest aircraft flight records from McDonnell Aircraft Corporation and the U.S. Naval Air Station revealed no flights at the time of the sighting, suggesting the object was not a known aircraft.

Investigations and interviews with neighbors, local authorities, and flight control units did not reveal any information contradicting the credibility of the witnesses or suggesting an alternative explanation.
sighted object: Dark reddish brown UFO with an oscillating motion
photographs: The report does not include photographs
